document.docAuthor: Kim, Hyung June, Lee, Sang-Hui & Kang, Dong Won
document.docTitle: Haliclona (Haliclona) ieoensis Kim & Lee & Kang 2017, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: New species of the Genus Haliclona (Haplosclerida: Chalinidae) from Korea

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New species of the Genus Haliclona (Haplosclerida: Chalinidae) from Korea

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype .
Korea , Jeju-do , Seogqipo-si , Daejeong-eup , Ieodo ,
15 m
,
June 7, 2016
, SCUBA diving, coll. Sang-Hui Lee , MABIK IV00155509
.
Paratype. Ieodo, 6â€“20 m , November 5, 2015 , SCUBA diving, coll. In young Cho, MABIK IV00155510â€“ IV00155513.

Description . Shape ( Fig. 2A ): Holotype . Encrusting, 1.6 cm in thickness and 5 cm in width, with small oscules flush on surface. Paratype . Irregularly massive, encrusting with low chimney- and volcano- shaped elevations, about 0.3â€“0.5 cm in height and 4.5 cm in diameter.
Oscula : Holotype . 0.1â€“0.5 cm in diameter, scattered on surface. Paratype . Irregularly scattered and commonly situated at the top of volcano or chimney shaped elevations.
Colour : Beige in life, gradually changing to ivory in alcohol.
Texture : Soft, fragile, and compressible.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 2.
Haliclona ieoensis
sp. nov.
: (A) Image of Holotype Specimen, (B) Ectosomal skeleton, (Câ€“E) Choanosomal skeleton, (F) Oxea.

subSubSection.paragraph: Surface : Smooth and even.

Skeleton ( Fig. 2 Bâ€“E ): Ectosomal skeleton not specialized, reticularly arranged by unispicular oxea. Choanosomal skeleton composed of ladder-like reticulation by uni-paucispicular primary lines regularly connected by unispicular secondary lines.
Spicules ( Fig. 2F , Table 1 ): Two types of oxea, no microscleres. Thick oxea approximately 190 to 230 Ã— 10 to 12.5 Âµm in size. Thin oxea approximately 160 to 175 Ã— 2.5 to 5 Âµm in size.

Remarks.
Haliclona ieoensis
sp. nov.
is similar to
Haliclona ( Haliclona ) tonggumiensis
Kang & Sim 2013
in shape, but the former differs from the latter in its ectosomal skeleton structure and spicule size. The ectosomal skeleton of
Haliclona ieoensis
sp. nov.
is not specialized. It is reticularly arranged by unispicular oxea. However, skeletal structure on surface of
H . ( H .) tonggumiensis
arranged by unispicular oxea under membrane with pores, and single oxea slightly hispid to outer surface. The size of the oxeas of
Haliclona ieoensis
sp. nov .
is larger than that of
H . ( H .) tonggumiensis
( Table 2 ).

Distribution. Only found in Ieodo at depth of
6â€“ 20 m
.
Etymology. Named after the type locality, Ieodo, Jejudo , Korea .

subSubSection.paragraph: Description . Shape ( Fig. 3A ): Hollow, cylindrical or slightly compressed tube from flexible stalk, 0.5 cm in thickness, 5â€“6 cm in height, and 1â€“2 cm in width.
Colour : Ivory while live. Beige in alcohol.
Oscula : 1.5 cm in diameter, open at top of tube.
Texture : Soft, fragile, compressible.
Surface : Smooth, even, minutely hispid.

Skeleton ( Fig. 3Bâ€“D ): Ectosomal skeleton absent, single or triple oxea slightly hispid to outer surface. Choanosomal skeleton composed of ladder-like reticulation by uniâ€”paucispicular primary lines regularly connected by unispicular secondary lines.

Spicules ( Fig. 3Eâ€“F ): Megascleres are two type of oxeas and the microscleres are toxa. Oxea, slender, slightly flexuous. Thick oxea approximately 140 to 160 Ã— 8 to 10 Âµm in size. Thin oxea approximately 110 to 150 Ã— 2.5 to 4 Âµm in size. Toxa approximately 25â€“40 Âµm in size.

Remarks . The species described here is similar to
H . ( H .) urceolus
(see Weerdt, 1986 ). Both species are similar in shape and skeletal arrangement. The megascleres consist mainly of oxea. However,
H . ( H .) urceolus
differs from the present species by the spicule size and abundant toxa (microscleres).
Haliclona sumenyoensis
sp. nov.
has two types (oxea and toxa), but that of
H . ( H .) urceolus
only has oxea.

Distribution . Only found in the Gageodo Island at depth of
18 m .
Etymology . Named after the type locality, Sumenyo, Gageodo, Korea .
